com.adobe.aem.init.dogmatix.util

Class XmlUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.adobe.aem.init.dogmatix.util.XmlUtils

  • public class XmlUtils
extends Object
    Util class exposing routines for XML parsing, reading, validation and traversing.
    Author:
    vnagpal

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public static String read(InputStream is)
                   throws IOException
        Reads the XML input file line by line and returns a String containing the contents
        Parameters:
        is - the inputStream pointing to the XML source
        Returns:
        the XML file content in a String
        Throws:
        IOException

      • validate

        public static boolean validate(String inputXml,
               InputStream xsd)
        Validates the inputXml string against an XML Schema Definition file
        Parameters:
        inputXml - XML string to validate
        xsd - the inputStream pointing to the XSD file containing the schema definition
        Returns:
        true if the XML confirms to the schema defined in a valid XSD, false otherwise.

      • parse

        public static Document parse(String inputXml,
             boolean normalize)
                      throws SAXException,
                             IOException,
                             ParserConfigurationException
        Convert a String with XML content into a Document object model.
        Parameters:
        inputXml - the string to parse
        normalize - boolean to instruct parser to normalize the DOM tree. If true, coalesces the Text Nodes. Node.normalize()
        Returns:
        the org.w3c.Document DOM tree representation of the XML string passed in
        Throws:
        SAXException - thrown when the document builder SAX parser encounters any error
        IOException - thrown if any I/O error occurs while reading the input XML
        ParserConfigurationException - thrown if any error encountered while configuring the parser in the document builder

      • lookup

        public static NodeList lookup(Document doc,
              String xPath,
              String separator)
        Traverses the DOM tree to lookup the XPath. A sample XPath would look like "Parent > Child > Grandchild" for a DOM tree as following:
        Parameters:
        doc - The DOM tree to traverse
        xPath - A path to lookup
        separator - String separator used to break up level hierarchy with in the path
        Returns:
        Node(s) found at the given path

      • lookup

        public static NodeList lookup(Element e,
              String xPath,
              String separator)
        Traverses the DOM tree to lookup the XPath. A sample XPath would look like "Parent > Child > Grandchild" for a DOM tree as following:
        Parameters:
        e - The DOM element to look under
        xPath - A path to lookup
        separator - String separator used to break up level hierarchy with in the path
        Returns:
        Node(s) found at the given path

      • text

        public static List<String> text(Document doc,
                String xPath,
                String separator)
        Gives the string representation of the XML element at the specified XPath in the DOM tree
        Parameters:
        doc - The DOM tree to traverse
        xPath - A path to lookup
        separator - String separator used to break up level hierarchy with in the path
        Returns:
        List List of string representations of the Node(s) found at the given path

      • text

                String separator)
        Gives the string representation of the XML element at the specified XPath in the DOM tree
        Parameters:
        e - The DOM Element to look under
        xPath - A path to lookup
        separator - String separator used to break up level hierarchy with in the path
        Returns:
        List List of string representations of the Node(s) found at the given path
